> Any seeds ready at =
a job's initial launch can be specified via the CXML
> configuration file. =
The supplied default configuration template in H3 
> demonstrates how they =
can be listed inline, in the configuration file 
> itself. That template al=
so includes a commented-out section marked 
> 'SEEDS ALTERNATE APPROACH' wh=
ich shows how an external file can be used 
> for these initial seeds inste=
ad, if desired. (Only one or the other of 
> the TextSeedsModule beans shou=
ld be active at a time.)
> 
> After the job is launched, the CXML is not re=
-consulted, so for a crawl 
> already running, another technique must be us=
ed.
> 
> The 'Action Directory' is the easiest: you just drop a new file wi=
th the 
> suffix ".seeds" into the directory, and the crawl will detect and=
 
> process that file, moving it to the 'done' directory (so that the 
> 'a=
ction' directory stays empty).
> 
> For example, the file could be called "=
monday.seeds" and use the same 
> line-by-line notation (including '+' and =
'-' directives which can affect 
> scope) as when included at initial launc=
h time.
> 
> It's best to compose this file elsewhere and then move it to t=
he 
> 'action' directory as a final atomic step... otherwise while 
> editt=
ing/appending to it, it may be processes and moved-aside in partial 
> form=
.
> 
> It is not necessary to pause the crawl before dropping a new file in=
to 
> the 'action' directory.
> 
> If you need URLs added in ways other tha=
n as 'seeds' =96 for example, 
> force-refetched, treated-as-already-includ=
ed, or 
> enqueued-with-hops-and-via, then the other suffixes (".force", 
>=
 ".include", ".schedule") documented on that web page may also be of 
> int=
erest. (I'm going to improve the explanation there a bit.)
> 
> - Gordon
